New Records: Kyle Schwarber matched a major league record with his 13th leadoff home run this season
Brady Anderson for ninth with 44 leadoff homers
Key Match Events: Schwarber drove a 1-0 pitch from right-hander Bowden Francis into the second deck in right, matching Alfonso Soriano’s total
Harper left after he was hit on the left elbow by a 92 mph fastball in the first inning
Realmuto homered off right-hander Ryan Burr to start the ninth, his 12th
Pre-Game Insights: There’s a lot of talk about how he doesn’t steal bases, he doesn’t do this, he doesn’t do that
Manager Rob Thomson credited catcher Realmuto for identifying an early problem with Sánchez’s changeup, and the lefty for correcting it
Post-Match Reflections: “We all know when Kyle gets hot, man, it’s fun to watch,” Phillies first baseman Bryce Harper said
“That guy is special,” Francis said of Schwarber. “He’s hot right now. It’s like throwing to Vladdy.”
Thomson said he isn't convinced it's worth taking a couple of days off to rest
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phillies selected the contract of RHP Nick Nelson from Triple-A Lehigh Valley and optioned RHP Tyler Phillips to Triple-A
Blue Jays relievers have allowed a major league-high 82 home runs
